results.title: Architect Athfield
results.creator_credit: Sam Neill, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Examines the practical philosophy, the achievements and frustrations of one of New Zealand’s most lively and innovative architects, Ian Athfield. In 1975 Athfield won an international competition directed towards providing housing for 140,000 squatters from the Tondo area in Manila.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Neill, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Nambo
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Don Murray and Australian Agency for International Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Solomon Islands”.
Nambo is a large fruit grown in the Solomon Islands. Islanders are shown preparing and drying the fruits for local sale. Nambo is harvested from the forest, cut into pieces and dried and shipped to Honiara. Nambo is said to be more nutritious than biscuits. Photography by Dean Semler.

results.title: Araha Ana Romo
results.creator_credit: Martin Cohen, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Solomon Islands”.
This documentary shows the bartering system, traditions and ceremonies on the Solomon Islands, particularly the ceremonies surrounding the election and inauguration of a new chief on one of the islands.

results.title: Moro: Melanesian bigman
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Solomon Islands”.
Moro and his people live on the island of Guadalcanal in the central Solomons. Some see him as a ‘cult leader’ and others ‘a confused power hungry man’. But to the people of the Solomon Island he is a real Melanesian Bigman who has rejected the use of modern technology. Cinematographer: Dean Semler. Narrated by Alfred Aihunu.

results.title: Bifo Kam
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Solomon Islands”.
One of a series on the Solomon Islands, this film is concerned with the traditional culture of the Solomon Islands. It shows the construction of a canoe at Taumako, and the making of feather money which is used for dowry payments. Narrated by Alfred Aihunu; photography by Dean Semler. English commentary, Solomon Islands dialogue with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graham Chase, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Anyone can be a genius
results.creator_credit: Julian Russell, Channel Communications and Bush Christmas Productions
results.brief_description: This is a film about the meaning of life, about why the human brain is the most extraordinary thing ever created. Sit back and watch the exploding rocket, the eccentric animation, what it means to be a parent, Land Rights, the re-enactment of Archimedes and listen to the 21 original compositions of music. Or look at Latin America in a way you’ve never seen before. Narrated by Noni Hazlehurst.

results.title: Arafura to Alice
results.creator_credit: Nick Torrens, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A film showing life in Darwin, Tennant Creek, Alice Springs, and Ayers Rock in the early 1980’s. This demanding, tough and often inhospitable part of Australia is inhabited by a special type of Australian and is opening up to anyone who is prepared to accept the challenge that the Northern Territory offers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nick Torrens, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
